Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Transform the scaled sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane. Create a circle centered at [0.054, 0.054] with a radius of 0.054. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1079. Transform the scaled sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along the opposite direction of its normal by a depth of 0.275, creating a tapered cylindrical object with a central hole along its height. The resulting assembly involves creating three intermediate parts, each constructed with varying shapes: * A cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom and a central hole with dimensions: length=0.75, width=0.75, and height=0.0625 * A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and dimensions: length=0.2315, width=0.2315, and height=0.0575 * A cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom with dimensions: length=0.1079, width=0.1079, and height=0.275</description>
